content:
• Friday, March 22, 2013
  • IDIX

    Idenix Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:IDIX) says the USPTO's Patent Trial and Appeal Board has decided...

    Idenix Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:IDIX) says the USPTO's Patent Trial and Appeal Board has decided against it in the first phase of its two-stage interference process concerning one of IDIX's patent applications, and an issued patent owned by Gilead Pharmasset (NASDAQ:GILD) that covers certain 2'-methyl- 2'-fluoro nucleoside compounds useful in the treatment of the hepatitis C virus. Shares -13% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:01 PM
  • SFD

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: SFD +6%. REGI +6%. GTI +4%. FIVE +4%. KWK +4%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: SFD +6%. REGI +6%. GTI +4%. FIVE +4%. KWK +4%.
    After-hours top losers: IDIX -10%. TTS -6%. SVU -4%. MTG -3%. ARNA -2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:44 PM | 3 Comments
  • SFD

    Smithfield Foods (NYSE:SFD) has hired Goldman Sachs to explore its options, after Continental...

    Smithfield Foods (NYSE:SFD) has hired Goldman Sachs to explore its options, after Continental Grain, an agribusiness company which controls about 6% of the company, urged the hog producer to break up. Goldman will assist in analyzing and reviewing strategic options including instituting a cash dividend, bringing on new board members and executives with new skills, or potentially even splitting into three companies. Shares +3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:11 PM

  • The week's ETF movers - Gainers: AMJ +3.37%. VXX +2.24%. GDX +2.20%. XLP +2.13%. UNG +1.98%. ETF...

    The week's ETF movers - Gainers: AMJ +3.37%. VXX +2.24%. GDX +2.20%. XLP +2.13%. UNG +1.98%.
    ETF Losers: EPI -5.54%. BRF -4.26%. KOL -3.67%. EWZ -3.64%. FCG -3.43%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • IONS

    Isis Pharmaceuticals (ISIS -6.1%) becomes a casualty of the European Medicines Agency today, as...

    Isis Pharmaceuticals (ISIS -6.1%) becomes a casualty of the European Medicines Agency today, as the committee confirmed its previous position and maintained a negative opinion on the marketing authorization application for Kynamro as a treatment for patients with Homozygous Familial Hypercholesterolaemia.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM | 2 Comments
  • CYTX

    Cytori Therapeutics (CYTX -2.2%) retreats in afternoon trading after a U.S. Appeals court upheld...

    Cytori Therapeutics (CYTX -2.2%) retreats in afternoon trading after a U.S. Appeals court upheld an FDA decision not to approve two stem-cell therapy devices. The court agreed with the FDA, noting that the devices weren't "substantially equivalent to the cited predicate devices." CYTX says it plans to continue to seek approval for the therapy through the Premarket Approval route, which is far more complex and time-consuming than the traditional 510(k) premarket process.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM
  • KKR

    KKR (KKR -2%) and TPG Capital are apparently no longer planning to bid for Life Technologies...

    KKR (KKR -2%) and TPG Capital are apparently no longer planning to bid for Life Technologies (LIFE -0.1%). According to reports, the company is more likely to be sold to a corporate buyer, possibly Danaher (DHR +0.6%) or Thermo Fisher Scientific (TMO -0.9%). LIFE had initially sought a private equity firm to acquire the company in a leveraged buyout, but strategic bidders emerged who may be in better position because opportunities to cut costs mean they could make a higher offer.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM
  • SSN

    Samson Oil & Gas (SSN -15.6%) hits a 52-week low after last night's news it raised...

    Samson Oil & Gas (SSN -15.6%) hits a 52-week low after last night's news it raised $2.8M from U.S. institutional investors through a placement of American Depositary shares and a shareholder rights offering; SSN plans to use the proceeds to drill six development wells in North Dakota.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM | 2 Comments
  • BB

    BlackBerry (BBRY -6.9%) plummets as the WSJ reports AT&T (NYSE:T) "doesn't appear to be...

    BlackBerry (BBRY -6.9%) plummets as the WSJ reports AT&T (NYSE:T) "doesn't appear to be highlighting" the Z10 on its launch day, or "giving it prominent shelf space at its stores." The paper observes "fewer than 20 people" arrived at two Manhattan AT&T stores to see the Z10, and that a San Francisco store chose to display it "at a back corner of the store, away from a large sign advertising the iPhone 5." (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM | 65 Comments
  • SNY

    Sanofi's (SNY +1.4%) Genzyme says that the European Medicines Agency has issued a positive...

    Sanofi's (SNY +1.4%) Genzyme says that the European Medicines Agency has issued a positive opinion for the approval of Aubagio, which is a treatment of relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis. It did not howvever, recommend the drug receive a new active substance designation, which SNY believes could have a detrimental impact on future research on MS, as well as other diseases. The drug developer is now planning to request a re-examination of the decision.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM
  • GILD

    The hits keep coming out of Europe for healthcare stocks today, as Gilead Sciences (GILD +2%)...

    The hits keep coming out of Europe for healthcare stocks today, as Gilead Sciences (GILD +2%) moves up after the Europan Union's CHMP earlier today adopted a positive opinion on the company's Marketing Authorization for Stribild, a treatment for HIV-1 infection in patients who are antiretroviral-naive or are infected with HIV-1 without known mutations associated with resistance to any of the three antiretroviral agents in Stribild: elvitegravir, an integrase inhibitor, or cobicistat.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM
  • ODFL

    Old Dominion Freight (ODFL +5.5%) shares are strong after the less-than-truckload motor carrier...

    Old Dominion Freight (ODFL +5.5%) shares are strong after the less-than-truckload motor carrier last night raised expectations for Q1 tonnage growth to 4.5%-5% from a previous 4%-4.5% and affirmed expectations for a Y/Y increase in revenue per hundredweight excluding a fuel surcharge in range of 2.5%-3%. Goldman Sachs reiterates its Conviction Buy rating.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM
  • BIIB

    Biogen Idec (BIIB +1.2%) is another beneficiary of a positive opinion from the EU's Committee...

    Biogen Idec (BIIB +1.2%) is another beneficiary of a positive opinion from the EU's Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use, recommending that the company's Techfidera be granted marketing authorization as a first-line oral treatment for adults with relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis. BIIB notes the FDA is also expected to make a decision on its marketing application for the drug in the U.S. in the coming days.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • BP

    Analysts at Simmons say the scale of BP's (BP +2.4%) $8B buyback, at more than 6% of BP’s...

    Analysts at Simmons say the scale of BP's (BP +2.4%) $8B buyback, at more than 6% of BP’s market value, is larger than it had expected by ~$1B. But not everyone thinks it's money well spent: $8B spread over BP’s outstanding shares could pay a one-time dividend of ~$2.50/share, and there's little doubt what most shareholders would choose if they could.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM | 10 Comments
  • CRUS

    RBC's report about a cheaper iPhone arriving in the June/July timeframe appears to be giving a...

    RBC's report about a cheaper iPhone arriving in the June/July timeframe appears to be giving a lift to Cirrus Logic (CRUS +3.2%). A prediction the device will yield $22B in 2014 sales on the back of 72M shipments probably isn't hurting either. Whereas many on the Street are ambivalent about the impact of a less costly iPhone on Apple - positive on its sales/market share effect, but concerned about cannibalization and margin pressure - its arrival would be a clear-cut positive for Cirrus, provided it lands the phone's audio codec slot.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM
  • HUM

    Humana (HUM -2.9%) trades lower today after Susquehanna cut the shares to Neutral and lowered...

    Humana (HUM -2.9%) trades lower today after Susquehanna cut the shares to Neutral and lowered its target price to $74 from $85. The firm says it's opting to stay away from the potential volatility, believing the shares could swing wildly between the high-$40s to the mid-$80s depending on how the final 2014 Medicare Advantage rates - due to be released April 1 - play out.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:38 PM
  • WSTC

    Unlike Marin Software, West Corp. (NASDAQ:WSTC) is having an unpleasant opening day. After...

    Unlike Marin Software, West Corp. (NASDAQ:WSTC) is having an unpleasant opening day. After pricing its 21.3M-share IPO at $20 (below a range of $22-$25), shares opened at $19.04 and are currently at $19.15, down 4.3%. That's good for a market cap of $1.6B. The provider of conferencing and contact center outsourcing services posted 2012 revenue of $2.64B (+6% Y/Y) and net income of $125.5M (-2%). It competes with IT and telecom giants offering hosted services, as well as smaller firms such as ShorteTel (NASDAQ:SHOR) and 8x8 (NASDAQ:EGHT). (S-1)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM
  • NLY

    The mREITs are back in favor after the Fed's QE∞ hit interest margins in Q4. A widening...

    The mREITs are back in favor after the Fed's QE∞ hit interest margins in Q4. A widening yield curve helps, but managements weren't powerless either. Share buybacks below book and altered business plans - Annaly's purchase of CreXus for one, others upping exposure to non-agency RMBS another - are sitting well with investors. Up 2.1% today, NLY is trading above book for the first time in a long time.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM | 2 Comments
  • AMX

    After 14 hours of debate, Mexico's lower house has approved an amended version of a telecom...

    After 14 hours of debate, Mexico's lower house has approved an amended version of a telecom reform bill that seeks to create a new independent regulator and remove foreign investment limits on wireline carriers. Some details still need to be worked out, such as whether reciprocal foreign investment arrangements should be required of the home countries of investing firms. America Movil (AMX +2.8%) is rallying for the second day in a row. Grupo Televisa (TV +0.6%) is up slightly.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM
  • UAA

    Under Armour (UA +3.6%) trades higher with Nike's strong performance in North America helping to...

    Under Armour (UA +3.6%) trades higher with Nike's strong performance in North America helping to tip sentiment. Though most analysts think there is enough global demand for both sports apparel companies to thrive, the question on Under Armour is if it can match Nike's success on the margins front.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM
  • GPK

    Graphic Packaging (GPK -2.8%) slides after the company announced that selling stockholders have...

    Graphic Packaging (GPK -2.8%) slides after the company announced that selling stockholders have increased the size of its previously announced secondary offering from 25M shares to 28M shares and priced it at $7 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • GT

    Goodyear Tire (GT -1.6%) says it's begun construction on the first of a new generation of...

    Goodyear Tire (GT -1.6%) says it's begun construction on the first of a new generation of airships to replace its fleet of blimps. The new Zeppelin LZ N07-101 airship, manufactured by Germany's ZLT Zeppelin Luftschifftechnik, will be assembled at GT's Wingfoot Lake Hangar near Akron, Ohio.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM | 1 Comment
  • RTW

    Shares of New York & Co (NWY -10.3%) shoot lower after the retailer guides estimates for Q1...

    Shares of New York & Co (NWY -10.3%) shoot lower after the retailer guides estimates for Q1 sales to below the consensus mark of analysts. The company says February sales have been weak and that for Q1 it now expects to see revenue dip in the low single-digit range (Y/Y).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM
  • ANTH

    Anthera Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ANTH +2.4%) gains after announcing earlier today that data from its...

    Anthera Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ANTH +2.4%) gains after announcing earlier today that data from its Phase 2b Pearl-SC study will be presented at the 10th International Congress on Systemic Lupus Erythematosus on April 20. The presentation will be in the form of an abstract entitled "Blisibimod, an Emerging Subcutaneous Biologic Therapy for Patients with Active, Moderate-to-Severe Systemic Lupus Erythematosus."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • TTNP

    Shares of Titan Pharmaceuticals (TTNP +35%) rise dramatically after the company says the FDA...

    Shares of Titan Pharmaceuticals (TTNP +35%) rise dramatically after the company says the FDA recommends approval for its opioid addiction treatment drug Probuphine. The terms of a licensing agreement announced last year indicate Titan will receive $50M from its commercialization partner Braeburn Pharmaceuticals upon FDA approval. 

     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM | 2 Comments
  • AVDL

    Flamel Technologies (FLML +3.2%) says that a U.S. District Court has dismissed a class action...

    Flamel Technologies (FLML +3.2%) says that a U.S. District Court has dismissed a class action suit against the company, and its former CEO. The initial class action, filed in 2007, alleged that the company made false claims about Coreg CR, a medication commonly used to treat conditions related to the heart and blood vessels. In dismissing the case, the judge stated that there was no substantive fact, and no reasonable jury could possibly find in the lead plaintiff's favor.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • TIBX

    "Our issues are primarily execution-related," Tibco (TIBX -15.3%) CEO Vivek Ranadive asserts on...

    "Our issues are primarily execution-related," Tibco (TIBX -15.3%) CEO Vivek Ranadive asserts on his company's FQ1 call. He suggests Tibco has "weak leadership" in the Americas and the U.K., and hints at a restructuring. Shares have been hit with 2 downgrades following a revenue miss and light guidance. An 8% Y/Y sales drop in the critical finance vertical and a decline in $1M+ deals offset 50% growth in telecom. Randadive argues Tibco's ability to process both business transactions and events through its middleware/analytics offerings is a key differentiator. INFA -5.6% (previous). QLIK -3.1%. MSTR -2.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM | 1 Comment
  • GENTY

    Gentium SpA (GENT -5.3%) trades lower today - albeit up significantly from the 16% pounding it...

    Gentium SpA (GENT -5.3%) trades lower today - albeit up significantly from the 16% pounding it took just prior to the open - after the company said the European Medicines Agency's Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use rejected Defibrotide, its treatment for hepatic veno-occlusive disease. GENT will appeal the EMA's decision.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • LULU

    Shares of Lululemon (LULU -3.5%) take another a leg down despite a spirited defense from...

    Shares of Lululemon (LULU -3.5%) take another a leg down despite a spirited defense from Canaccord Genuity (reiterated buy, $87 PT). Concerns about manufacturing issues look like they could linger for a while and the retailer's CEO response during an earnings conference call on how to detect a problem with too-thin yoga pants didn't overwhelm investors. Christine Day on quality control: "The only way that you can actually test for the issue is to put the pants on and bend over." (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM | 5 Comments
  • ALIM

    Alimera Sciences (ALIM +5.2%) pops after the company reported a better-than-expected Q4 loss of...

    Alimera Sciences (ALIM +5.2%) pops after the company reported a better-than-expected Q4 loss of $0.17, which beat analyst estimates of a loss of $0.23 per share, and was narrower than the prior year's loss of $0.19. Looking forward, the company says it's about to begin the commercial launch of Iluvien, a treatment for diabetic macular edema, and expects to begin generating revenue in the second quarter of this year. Read more on earnings here: Earnings Call Transcript.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • EGLE

    The runaway rally in dry bulk shipping stocks isn't knocking the socks off of Wells Fargo. The...

    The runaway rally in dry bulk shipping stocks isn't knocking the socks off of Wells Fargo. The investment firm is quick to point out that multiple companies in the sector are likely to see bankruptcy or restructuring. Proceed with caution: EGLE, GNK, DRYS, DSX, PRGN, NEWL, FREE, NM, SBLK, ESEA.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM | 6 Comments
  • ANAC

    Shares of Anacor Pharmaceuticals (ANAC +35%) rocket higher again today, adding to yesterday's...

    Shares of Anacor Pharmaceuticals (ANAC +35%) rocket higher again today, adding to yesterday's +26% gain after the company announced positive results from a Phase 2 dose-ranging trial of its topical ointment, AN2728. The company said lesions treated with AN2728 achieved a 71% improvement from baseline in their Atopic Dermatitis Severity Index score, with 66% of lesions achieving total or partial clearance. The stock is now fast approach a 52-week high not seen since October of last year.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • MRIN

    Marin Software's (NASDAQ:MRIN) IPO is as good as promised. After pricing its 7.5M-share offering...

    Marin Software's (NASDAQ:MRIN) IPO is as good as promised. After pricing its 7.5M-share offering at $14 (above a range of $11-$13), shares opened at $19 and are currently at $17.90, up 27.9%. That gives the online ad campaign software firm a market cap of $553M, or 9.3x 2012 sales. (S-1) (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • MU

    Micron's (MU +10.5%) FQ2 beat, partly driven by 8% Q/Q NAND flash sales growth, provides a lift...

    Micron's (MU +10.5%) FQ2 beat, partly driven by 8% Q/Q NAND flash sales growth, provides a lift to SanDisk (SNDK +2%). Micron stated on its earnings call it sees "a favorable supply and demand balance" for NAND, thanks to strong SSD/mobile device demand and slowing manufacturing process shifts. Micron's trade NAND ASP was "relatively flat" in FQ2, and is estimated to be down mid-single-digits thus far in FQ3. Micron also forecasts DRAM industry capacity will fall in 2013 and 2014, and suggests it will shift some of its DRAM capacity to NAND. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM
  • NKE

    Nike's (NKE +10.9%) broad sales gains in North America and e-commerce channels during Q4 were...

    Nike's (NKE +10.9%) broad sales gains in North America and e-commerce channels during Q4 were impressive enough to help drive shares to 52-week highs, but Morningstar warns that long-term sales growth needs to be derived from China and other emerging markets. Revenue in China fell 9% to $635M as a couple of misfires on product strategy dealt a blow. What to watch: If gross margins continue to impress and the company can execute in China and Japan while keeping its momentum going in North America - even more upside could be in store.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • ZIOP

    Ziopharm Oncology (ZIOP -5.8%) opens down big after Adam Feurstein reports an oft-correct source...

    Ziopharm Oncology (ZIOP -5.8%) opens down big after Adam Feurstein reports an oft-correct source has shorted the stock ahead of what he/she thinks will be the failure of next week's results of the palifosfamide sarcoma study.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM
  • WPM

    Silver Wheaton (SLW +2.1%) shoots higher at the open after last night's Q4 report said earnings...

    Silver Wheaton (SLW +2.1%) shoots higher at the open after last night's Q4 report said earnings hit a record $0.50/share vs. $0.41 a year earlier and revenue also set a record at $287M. Attributable silver equivalent output rose 22% to 8.5M oz. Average cash costs rose to $4.70 per silver equivalent oz. from $4.06 a year ago.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • MDLZ

    Mondelez (MDLZ +2.9%) trades higher with a Nelson Peltz-premium getting baked into shares on the...

    Mondelez (MDLZ +2.9%) trades higher with a Nelson Peltz-premium getting baked into shares on the prospect that the activist investor could push for major changes at the company - possibly even a merger with PepsiCo. JPMorgan analyst Ken Goldman is raining on the PEP-MDLZ speculation parade a bit, saying the companies wouldn't blend together neatly and that a deal could raise anti-trust issues.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM | 8 Comments
  • R

    Raymond James upgrades Ryder System (R +2.9%) to Strong Buy with a $74 price target. The shares...

    Raymond James upgrades Ryder System (R +2.9%) to Strong Buy with a $74 price target. The shares are trading higher on the news. 

     
     
     
     
    | 9:35 AM
  • HALO

    Halozyme Therapeutics (NASDAQ:HALO) +18.6% premarket after the European Medicines Agency...

    Halozyme Therapeutics (NASDAQ:HALO) +18.6% premarket after the European Medicines Agency approves partner Baxter (NYSE:BAX) for the use of HALO's HyQvia as replacement therapy for adult patients with primary and secondary immunodeficiencies. Upon receiving marketing authorization from the EC, BAX plans to launch HyQvia in some European countries later this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • HALO

    Premarket gainers: HALO +23%. ANAC +18%. MU +9%. OTC:AFFY +8%. NKE +8%.Losers: TIBX -16%. ABR...

    Premarket gainers: HALO +23%. ANAC +18%. MU +9%. OTC:AFFY +8%. NKE +8%.
    Losers: TIBX -16%. ABR -6%. ZIOP -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • PEP

    PepsiCo (NYSE:PEP) unveils a new shape for 20-ounce bottles of Pepsi products as part of a...

    PepsiCo (NYSE:PEP) unveils a new shape for 20-ounce bottles of Pepsi products as part of a broader plan to update marketing and packaging materials for the brand. The company's overall beverage volume in the North America declined 4% last year and it has been losing market share in the Coke vs. Pepsi battle. PEP +1.8% premarket with buzz picking up on what Trian Fund Management's new investment might portend.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:30 AM | 1 Comment
  • MU

    Micron (NASDAQ:MU) now higher by 7.7% post-earnings as Jefferies raises its price target to a...

    Micron (NASDAQ:MU) now higher by 7.7% post-earnings as Jefferies raises its price target to a Street-high $15 from $10, while bumping its 2013 and 2014 EPS estimates to $0.48 (from -$0.20) and $2.57 (from $0.76), respectively. "We believe there is upside to our Street-high estimates." Credit Suisse raises its PT to $14 from $8, highlighting extremely favorable supply dynamics.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:18 AM
  • MFRM

    Stifel Nicolaus upgrades Mattress Firm (NASDAQ:MFRM) to a Buy rating from Hold with a $37 price...

    Stifel Nicolaus upgrades Mattress Firm (NASDAQ:MFRM) to a Buy rating from Hold with a $37 price target. Shares of MFRM are 1.7% higher premarket while the mattress sector (TPX, ZZ, SCSS) is on watch for a sympathy rally.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:18 AM
  • NKE

    Execs with Nike (NYSE:NKE) highlighted the "huge" consumer demand for the company's expanded...

    Execs with Nike (NYSE:NKE) highlighted the "huge" consumer demand for the company's expanded launch of the Flyknit brand of running shoes during the firm's earnings conference call. The next phase: Nike plans to bring capacity up to speed with demand and sees leveraging Flyknit across other categories. NKE +7.8% premarket. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:12 AM

  • The Nikkei dives 2.4% and the yen (FXY) strengthens 0.4% as new BOJ Governor Kuroda's...

    The Nikkei dives 2.4% and the yen (FXY) strengthens 0.4% as new BOJ Governor Kuroda's ex-colleagues express doubt about his vows to hit a 2% inflation target. Included was the man formerly known as Mr. Yen for his ability to divine (and drive) the currency's moves - Eisuke Sakakibara - saying the inflation rate "will never reach 2% ... the deflation is structural." EWJ -0.6% , DXJ -0.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:04 AM | 2 Comments
  • BP

    After nearly three years of hell since the Deepwater Horizon disaster whacked nearly 30% from...

    After nearly three years of hell since the Deepwater Horizon disaster whacked nearly 30% from the value of their holdings, BP shareholders finally get something back via the $8B share buyback. But the buyback will only serve to offset the EPS dilution now that BP will no longer receive profits from its Russian cash cow; TNK-BP once generated ~30% of BP’s output and ~25% of its net profit. Shares +3.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:47 AM | 5 Comments
  • TIF

    Shares of Tiffany (NYSE:TIF) move 3.1% higher premarket as investors look at the glass half-full...

    Shares of Tiffany (NYSE:TIF) move 3.1% higher premarket as investors look at the glass half-full on the company's mixed report for Q4. Retail analyst Stacey Widlitz acknowledges the retailer's improvement in Japan and stable guidance, but notes the two-year same-store sales comparisons look weak.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:35 AM

  • Germany's Ifo Index of business confidence unexpectedly drops to 106.7 this month from 107.4 in...

    Germany's Ifo Index of business confidence unexpectedly drops to 106.7 this month from 107.4 in February and vs consensus of 107.6. Current assessment 109.9 vs 110.2 and 110.4. Expectations 103.6 vs 104.6 and 104.9. The Dax immediately dives but quickly recovers to its previous level of -0.5%, while the euro also slides and is flat.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 AM

  • Asian and European shares are mostly lower as the crisis in Cyprus heads for what could be the...

    Asian and European shares are mostly lower as the crisis in Cyprus heads for what could be the endgame on Monday, with an exit from eurozone not an impossibility. Japanese fell especially sharply after new BOJ governor Haruhiko Kuroda yesterday offered no new details about how he's going to print his country out of deflation. Japan -2.4%, Hong Kong -0.5%, China +0.2%, India -0.3%. EU Stoxx 50 -0.6%, London -0.2%, Paris -0.4%, Frankfurt -0.5%, Milan -0.4%, Madrid -0.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 AM
